Subjective: Sore throat for 3 days; fever this morning; cough last week; unbearable pain when swallowing; took paracetamol and ibuprofen; concerned about abscess; impact on daily life: unable to play tennis due to fatigue; no shortness of breath; no runny nose; no one around him is sick; Request: Wants antibiotics; afraid of having an abscess.
Objective: Vitals: Temperature 38.3°C; Saturation 98%; Physical Exam: Ears: normal; Throat: slightly red pharyngeal arch; enlarged tonsils; little slough on both sides; no abscess; Lungs: vesicular breath sounds; no additional sounds; Neck: small lymph nodes, submandibular, not pathological.
Assessment: Viral pharyngitis; no signs of abscess or bacterial infection.
Plan: • Continue taking paracetamol 4 times a day and ibuprofen 3 times a day as needed for pain; • Drink plenty of fluids; • Use cold drinks or popsicles to help with pain; • Wait it out; • Safety net: contact us if symptoms worsen, shortness of breath, or unable to swallow properly; • No antibiotics prescribed; • Follow-up: not scheduled.
